title: Apple Days Sale: Vijay Sales brings deals on iPhones, iPads, Macs, more - Business Standard
summary:
Apple Days Sale: Vijay Sales brings deals on iPhones, iPads, Macs, more

Last Updated: Dec 30 2024 | Source: Business Standard

Vijay Sales has launched the "Apple Days Sale," offering significant discounts on various Apple products, including the latest iPhone models and MacBooks, from December 29, 2024, to January 5, 2025.

  • Discounts of up to Rs 10,000 available with bank offers from ICICI, SBI, and Kotak Bank.
  • Trade-in deals for older devices with bonuses of up to Rs 10,000.
  • Offers on display units of select Apple products, such as the iPhone 13 starting at Rs 32,900.
  • Discounted prices on iPhone 16 series: effective prices range from Rs 57,490 to Rs 127,650.
  • MacBook discounts: Effective prices for MacBook Air start from Rs 63,890.
"During the Apple Days Sale, we aim to provide exciting offers and discounts to our customers on premium Apple products." - Vijay Sales spokesperson

This sale presents an opportunity for Apple fans to purchase products at reduced prices, making high-quality technology more accessible.
newTitle: Apple Days Sale: Vijay Sales Offers Discounts on Apple Products

title: Snowfall And Sub-Zero Temperatures In Kashmir: Doctors Warn Of Heart Attack And Stroke Risk! - Times Now
summary:
Kashmir's Winter Warnings: Heart Attack and Stroke Risks Spike Amid Snowfall and Cold Temperatures

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times Now

As temperatures in Kashmir plunge below freezing, health experts warn of heightened risks for heart attacks and strokes. The Department of Cardiology at GMC Srinagar has issued an advisory for residents, especially those at higher risk, to take precautions.

  • Heart-related emergencies, such as Myocardial Infarction (MI), are leading causes of death worldwide.
  • 30% of adults in Kashmir suffer from hypertension, significantly increasing risk factors.
  • Cold weather increases blood pressure and stresses the heart due to vasoconstriction.
“Increased consumption of salt... and reliance on processed foods contribute to elevated blood pressure,” - Dr Irfan Ahmed Bhat.

Preventative measures include staying warm, modifying outdoor activities, and regular health monitoring to manage risks effectively.
newTitle: Kashmir's Winter Warnings: Heart Attack and Stroke Risks Spike Amid Snowfall and Cold Temperatures

7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space - Times Now
summary:
7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Times Now

This article features a stunning collection of the latest space pictures captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing various celestial phenomena.

  • The Mice NGC 4676: Colliding spiral galaxies indicating star formation.
  • Westerlund 2: A star cluster located in a stellar nursery.
  • Discovering Protostellar OH 339.88-1.26: A dusty area with bright stars.
  • Young Star HH-47: A complex stellar formation.
  • XZ Tauri: A multiple star system with gas expulsion.
  • Red Giant Star CW Leonis: A stunning carbon star image.
  • Ghostly Star Forming Pillar: The Cone Nebula captured in detail.
“NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured an impressive image of the multiple star system known as XZ Tauri alongside neighbor HL Tauri and several young stellar objects.”

This article provides a glimpse into the wonders of space explored by the Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting remarkable cosmic phenomena.
newTitle: 7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space

title: 'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow - News18
summary:
'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow

Date: December 30, 2024
Source: News18

Tesla CEO Elon Musk has labeled the H-1B visa system as “broken” and called for “major reform” just days after expressing his willingness to defend the system, which allows skilled foreign workers to work in the US.

  • Musk stated that the current H-1B system needs significant reforms to better attract elite talent.
  • He suggested raising the minimum salary for H-1B visa applicants to make hiring foreign workers more expensive than hiring domestically.
  • The debate surrounding H-1B visas has intensified, particularly with political figures like Trump also voicing support for the program.
Easily fixed by raising the minimum salary significantly and adding a yearly cost for maintaining the H1B, making it materially more expensive to hire from overseas than domestically. I’ve been very clear that the program is broken and needs major reform. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 29, 2024

The impact of Musk’s comments reflects ongoing discussions about immigration and the role of foreign talent in the US economy.
newTitle: 'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow

title: 7 reasons to eat radish superfood in winter - Health shots
summary:
7 Health Benefits Of Radish In Winter

Published Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Healthshots

Looking for a winter superfood? Add radish to your diet. This crunchy and delicious vegetable is packed with several essential nutrients and offers numerous health benefits.

  • Packed With Nutrients: Radishes are low in calories but high in essential nutrients like vitamin C, potassium, folate, and fibre.
  • Hydrates Your Body: Comprising about 95% water, radishes keep the body hydrated and support kidney function.
  • Promotes Digestion: High in fibre, radishes help regulate bowel movements and promote healthy digestion.
  • Supports Weight Loss: Low in calories and high in fibre and water content, radishes make you feel full longer.
  • Lowers High Blood Pressure: Rich in potassium, radishes help maintain healthy fluid balance and regulate blood pressure.
  • Boosts Immunity: High vitamin C content strengthens the immune system, aiding in fighting off infections.
  • Good for Skin: Antioxidants and vitamin C in radishes help fight free radicals, reducing wrinkles and keeping skin youthful.
“Regular consumption of radishes may help reduce wrinkles and keep your skin looking youthful.”

Incorporating radish into your winter diet can provide a variety of health benefits, making it a great addition to meals.
newTitle: 7 Health Benefits of Eating Radish in Winter

title: The IQ of a 10-Year-Old Putting Brilliant People to Shame - Trade Flock
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: Pilot in Jeju Air plane crash mentioned bird strike, says Transport ministry official - The Indian Express
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

The pilot of the Jeju Air flight that crashed at Muan International Airport reported a bird strike shortly before declaring mayday and crashing, resulting in a national mourning period as investigations continue.

  • The crash claimed the lives of 179 passengers, leaving only two crew members.
  • The flight was arriving from Bangkok with 181 passengers and six crew members on board.
  • An emergency meeting was held, and a special disaster zone was declared at the crash site.
  • The incident occurred shortly after 9 am local time as the aircraft veered off the runway and hit a wall.
  • South Korean acting President Choi Sang-mok emphasized the government's commitment to recovery and prevention of future incidents.
“The government would like to offer its sincere condolences to the bereaved families and will do its best to recover from this accident and prevent a recurrence.” - Choi Sang-mok

This tragic incident highlights the critical need for safety measures in aviation following similar past occurrences.
newTitle: Pilot Reports Bird Strike in Jeju Air Plane Crash in South Korea

Punjab Bandh LIVE updates: Farmers protest hit traffic, other services in state, blockade at key entry points | Today News - Mint
Punjab bandh: Farmers block roads at many places, traffic hit - The Hindu
summary:
Punjab bandh farmers protest: Commuter traffic crippled; rail, bus service suspended

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Life was significantly disrupted in Punjab due to a statewide bandh called by farmers demanding a legal guarantee for minimum support prices (MSP) for their crops.

  • Rail and road traffic were heavily affected, leading to the suspension of various services.
  • Commercial establishments remained closed throughout the state.
  • Farmers conducted sit-ins on key roads, causing major traffic disruptions.
  • Emergency services were exempted from the bandh restrictions.
  • Farmer leaders claimed the bandh received wide support from different community groups.
“All establishments are closed. Punjabis have shown their unity today and they are extending full support,” claimed farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher.

The protest reflects the ongoing tensions between farmers and the central government regarding agricultural policies.
newTitle: Punjab Bandh: Farmers Protest Disrupts Commuter Traffic and Services

summary:
Asha Bhosle doesn't miss a beat even at 91 as she sings Tauba Tauba, recreates Vicky Kaushal's hook step at Dubai show

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

At 91, legendary singer Asha Bhosle continues to impress audiences with her performances. Recently, she performed the hit song Tauba Tauba during a concert in Dubai, showcasing her ability to keep up with current trends.

  • Asha Bhosle performed Tauba Tauba, a song by Karan Aujla, in Dubai.
  • She danced to the signature moves associated with the song, popularized by Vicky Kaushal.
  • Videos of her performance went viral, receiving widespread praise on social media.
  • Karan Aujla expressed his gratitude for her performance and shared his admiration on Instagram.
“Respect... WHAT AT 91... MOST ELDERLY PEOPLE I KNOW IN THEIR EARLY 60’S CAN’T EVEN WALK ON THEIR OWN AND LOOK AT ASHA TAI DOING ALL OF THAT WITH SO MUCH OF FLAMBOYANCE AND FINESSE.”

Asha Bhosle's vibrant performance at this age is a testament to her enduring talent and passion for music.

title: IND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah breaks Shoaib Akhtar's record - The Times of India
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Shoaib Akhtar's Record in Test Cricket

Publication Date: [Not available] Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah has surpassed Shoaib Akhtar by achieving his 13th five-wicket haul in Test cricket during the Boxing Day Test, establishing himself among the elite bowlers in the sport.

  • Bumrah now holds 13 five-wicket hauls, passing Akhtar’s record of 12.
  • He has taken 203 wickets in 44 Tests, while Akhtar had 178 in 46 matches.
  • Bumrah’s record puts him alongside legends like Michael Holding and Saqlain Mushtaq.
  • He excelled in the recent MCG Test, taking 5 wickets for 57 runs.
  • The ongoing series between India and Australia is tied 1-1.
Bumrah’s impressive performance has marked him as one of the greatest in the history of cricket.

This milestone enhances Bumrah's reputation and continues to excite fans as the series progresses.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Shoaib Akhtar's Record in Test Cricket

title: Rupee set to extend recovery on RBI-motivated dollar-long liquidation | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Rupee Set to Extend Recovery on RBI-Motivated Dollar-Long Liquidation

Date: December 30, 2023 Source: Reuters

The Indian rupee is expected to rise, continuing momentum from the previous session due to the Reserve Bank of India's interventions that prompted exiting speculative dollar-long positions.

  • The rupee is set to open between 85.40 and 85.42 against the U.S. dollar.
  • It recently hit a lifetime low of 85.8075, leading to heavy dollar sales by the RBI.
  • Traders noted that the RBI's intervention was significant, as it helped flush out excessive speculative positions.
  • High U.S. Treasury yields and concerns over U.S. trade policies have recently affected the rupee.
  • Key indicators include a one-month non-deliverable rupee forward at 85.70 and a dollar index at 108.
"Unless the trajectory of U.S. yields turns, the rupee will have it difficult," a currency dealer commented.

The RBI's ongoing interventions aim to mitigate the decline of the rupee, although its actions have driven forex reserves to a seven-month low.
newTitle: Rupee Set to Extend Recovery on RBI-Motivated Dollar-Long Liquidation

Gal Gadot reveals she was diagnosed with blood clot in brain during 4th pregnancy, underwent surgery during delivery - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gal Gadot reveals she was diagnosed with blood clot in brain during 4th pregnancy, underwent surgery during delivery

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Gal Gadot announced that she was diagnosed with a brain blood clot during her fourth pregnancy, leading to emergency surgery. She aims to raise awareness about this rare condition.

  • Gal Gadot gave birth to her daughter Ori earlier this year.
  • She suffered from excruciating headaches before being diagnosed with Cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT).
  • Approximately 3 in 100,000 pregnant women in their 30s+ are diagnosed with CVT.
  • Gadot underwent emergency surgery shortly before delivering Ori.
  • She emphasized the importance of listening to one’s body and raising awareness about CVT.
“It’s vital to listen to our bodies and trust what it’s telling us. Awareness matters.” - Gal Gadot

This experience has led Gadot to reflect on the fragility of life and the importance of health awareness.
newTitle: Gal Gadot Reveals Blood Clot Diagnosis During Pregnancy

This article highlights seven rare photographs of the universe captured by NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the beauty and mystery of our cosmos.

  • Asteroid Dimorphos captured on December 19, 2022.
  • ‘Spoke Season’ on Saturn observed from approximately 850 million miles away.
  • Image of the bright spiral galaxy MCG-01-24-014, located about 275 million light-years away.

  • Spiral galaxy NGC 6951 featuring bright blue spiral arms.
  • Rare Radio Galaxy NGC 612 exhibiting vibrant orange and blue streaks.
  • G35.2-0.7N region captured in stunning detail.
“These images not only provide scientific insight but also inspire awe about the universe we live in.”

The article emphasizes the importance of such images in understanding the universe's vastness and complexities, revealing both scientific and artistic marvels.

title: Rohit Sharma scripts ignominious record after Melbourne double failure as merciless fans say 'happy retirement' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rohit Sharma scripts ignominious record after Melbourne double failure as merciless fans say 'happy retirement'

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma's difficult form continued on Day 5 of the fourth Test against Australia, leading to harsh criticism from fans on social media following his dismissals which led to disturbing records.

  • Rohit scored a mere 164 runs in 15 innings with an average of 10.93 across three series since September.
  • His average dropped to 6.20 after the Melbourne failures, marking the lowest ever for a touring captain in Australia.
  • Fans began trending 'happy retirement' on social media, signaling discontent with his performance.
  • There are speculations regarding his potential retirement, especially after fellow player Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement.
  • Former cricketer Mark Waugh suggested Rohit should be replaced as captain if his poor form persists.
"It's a very tough way for Rohit Sharma to go ... his last 14 innings' he averages 11, so the signs are there that he's past his best." - Mark Waugh

The mounting pressure and calls for retirement could lead to significant changes in India's Test lineup as they proceed with the series.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Struggles Spark Retirement Speculation After Melbourne Double Failure

title: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Listing, Share Price LIVE: Shares to list on NSE, BSE today, key things to know - Upstox
summary:
Senores Pharmaceuticals Shares Debut with Strong Premium on NSE

Publication Date: December 30, 2023
Source: Upstox

Senores Pharmaceuticals made a strong debut on the stock market, listing at a significant premium over its issue price, showcasing investor confidence amidst robust subscription levels.

  • Stock debuted at ₹600 on NSE, a 53.45% premium over the issue price of ₹391.
  • Market capitalisation reached ₹2,652.69 crore after initial trading.
  • Shares saw fluctuations, with a decline to ₹576, representing a 4% drop shortly after listing.
  • The IPO was heavily subscribed, with an overall subscription of 93.69 times.
  • Lead book-running managers included Equirus Capital and Ambit.

“The issue was highly anticipated, and the strong listing reflects the market’s belief in Senores Pharmaceuticals’ growth potential.”

In conclusion, Senores Pharmaceuticals’ initial public offering highlights its promising start in the stock market, supported by significant investor interest and strategic financial objectives.
newTitle: Senores Pharmaceuticals Shares Debut with Strong Premium on NSE

title: Jimmy Carter's India connection: Haryana village was named 'Carterpuri' in his honour - The Times of India
summary:
Jimmy Carter's India connection: Haryana village was named 'Carterpuri' in his honour

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a heartwarming gesture, a village in Haryana has been named 'Carterpuri' to honour former U.S. President Jimmy Carter. This naming celebrates his humanitarian efforts and global contributions.

  • The village tribute reflects deep appreciation for Carter's humanitarian work.
  • Carter's impact in the fields of social justice and peace is recognized widely.
  • The name change symbolizes strong India-U.S. ties and cultural connections.
"A remarkable man whose dedication to peace and humanity will always inspire us." – Local resident.

This gesture not only pays homage to Carter's legacy but also strengthens the cultural exchange between India and the United States, emphasizing shared values of peace and humanitarianism.

title: Virat Kohli, Sam Konstas’ shoulder-bump incident inspires Kerala Police's unique road safety advisory - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kerala Police’s advisory on road safety, which uses footage of Virat Kohli bumping into Sam Konstas’ shoulder, has left social media users chuckling.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The on-field shoulder bump between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas has inspired an innovative road safety advisory from the Kerala Police, cleverly repurposing viral footage to convey an important message about road safety.

  • The footage shows Kohli bumping into Konstas during a cricket match, leading to a humorous yet serious traffic safety campaign.
  • The Kerala Police emphasized the importance of following traffic rules through the video, stating: “It's okay to be ‘King’. Follow traffic rules. While keeping yourself safe, keep others safe too.”
  • The campaign aims to convey crucial road safety messages through clever visual metaphors, utilizing the bump to illustrate dangers on the road.
“I think emotions got to both of us...but it happens in cricket,” - Sam Konstas on the shoulder bump incident.

This fusion of sports and road safety awareness has resonated well with social media users, emphasizing how impactful public safety messages can be when presented in creative ways.
newTitle: Kerala Police Uses Viral Kohli Incident for Road Safety Advisory

title: Intraday stocks for today under ₹100: Experts recommend three shares to buy today — 30 December 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to retire soon? Ravi Shastri delivers verdict, says ’Rohit isn’t the same, Virat will…’ - Mint
summary:
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to retire soon? Ravi Shastri delivers verdict, says ’Rohit isn’t the same, Virat will…’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

After another disappointing performance in the fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne, discussions about the potential retirement of Indian cricket stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have gained momentum. Former coach Ravi Shastri shared his views on the future of both players.

  • Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli struggled in both innings of the Test, raising questions about their future in cricket.
  • Ravi Shastri believes Kohli could play for another 3-4 years, but has concerns about Rohit's recent form.
  • Shastri commented on Rohit's footwork and performance, noting he seems to be meeting the ball late.
  • Rohit has scored just a total of 31 runs in three matches, while Kohli has 62 runs in five innings.
  • The ongoing discussion reflects the pressure on the two influential players following their poor form in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“I think Virat will play for some time. Forget the way he got out, or whatever. I think he'll play for another three or four years. As far as Rohit is concerned, it's a call.” - Ravi Shastri

The future of both players is under scrutiny as they struggle to perform at the critical juncture of their careers, resulting in increased speculation regarding their potential retirement.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli Retirement Discussions Intensify: Ravi Shastri's Insights
